Siblings help China's BYD grab early lead in Thai EV marketAfter launching BYD in Thailand as the Chinese electric vehicle maker's sole national distributor a little more than a year ago, siblings Pratarnwong and Pratarnporn Phornprapha were forced to rip up business plans frequently because sales kept rocketing. Tue, 27 Feb 2024 23:05:24 GMT EBVDNZPITZKILPLARGBHZREG4I https://www.reuters.com/business/autos-transportation/siblings-help-chinas-byd-grab-early-lead-thai-ev-market-2024-02-27/Devjyot Ghoshal, Chayut Setboonsarng商业汽车与交通
Applied Materials receives subpoena from SEC on China shipmentsSemiconductor equipment supplier Applied Materials received a subpoena from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) in February, requesting information relating to certain China customer shipments, the company said in a filing on Tuesday. Tue, 27 Feb 2024 22:21:18 GMT KSMJETRQM5P7BJIBCHSYQFFEQU https://www.reuters.com/technology/applied-materials-receives-subpoena-sec-china-shipments-2024-02-27/Reuters技术

US senators question Biden's Yemen strategy, want congressional authorizationU.S. Democratic and Republican senators on Tuesday questioned President Joe Biden’s strategy to deal with Houthi attacks against commercial shipping and contended he should seek congressional authorization for ongoing military action against the Yemen-based group. Tue, 27 Feb 2024 20:01:32 GMT CEHKKNOKRBKLLMRD2A7IYDCBLI https://www.reuters.com/world/us/senior-us-senators-want-congress-authorize-strikes-against-houthis-2024-02-27/Reuters世界美国
ASM International sees stable H1 revenue, GAA and China demand boost Q4 ordersSemiconductor equipment manufacturer ASM International on Tuesday forecast stable revenue for the first half of 2024 after a rise in orders in the fourth quarter of 2023 driven partly by its gate-all-around (GAA) chip-making technology. Tue, 27 Feb 2024 17:36:50 GMT D7OWDFUTDBKSDKE5KT2R75RORQ https://www.reuters.com/technology/asm-international-sees-stable-revenues-first-quarter-2024-02-27/Reuters技术
Europe EV makers need closer collaboration to catch up with China -Renault CEOEuropean carmakers and energy suppliers need to collaborate more to catch up with China in terms of the size of its electric vehicle (EV) sector, Renault boss Luca de Meo said on Tuesday.
